channel.title: CVE Feed for linux -- linux_kernel
channel.description: The latest CVEs for linux -- linux_kernel

item.title: CVE-2019-3016|2024-08-04T19:12:09.651Z -- linux -- linux_kernel
item.description: In a Linux KVM guest that has PV TLB enabled, a process in the guest kernel may be able to read memory locations from another process in the same guest. This problem is limit to the host running linux kernel 4.10 with a guest running linux kernel 4.16 or later. The problem mainly affects AMD processors but Intel CPUs cannot be ruled out.
